called epic games it is March 8th 2024
and you're watching the code report one
of the most disruptive forces in big
Tech right now is the European Union's
digital markets act its goal is to stop
Gatekeepers like Cloud providers and app
stores from abusing their power and its
compliance deadline was yesterday it
affects companies with a market cap
exceeding 75 billion EUR who also
control a core platform service like a
search engine social network app store
Marketplace cloud and so on for one it
requires data portability allowing users
to move to competing services this has
already motivated big clouds like Google
and Amazon just the other day to remove
egress fees when transferring to a
different cloud and that's a big win for
developers but dma also requires Sid
loading of thirdparty app stores and
other software that means Apple and
Google will have a harder time
extracting that creamy 30% mil from
their inapp purchases cash cows but
Apple was not deterred by these new
regulations they announced a new highly
complex fee structure for developers who
choose to distribute apps outside of the
App Store like a new core technology fee
which cost 50 cents per install for
every app distributed outside of the App
Store this plan was universally
criticized even Fang peers like
Microsoft and meta said it sucked as
Spotify called it extortion and epic
games called it bad faith compliance or
more specifically a hot garbage horror
show but epic has had an ongoing beef
with Apple for years that started one
fateful night back in August 2020 epic
games introduced a hot fix for fortnite
on iOS that gave players a way to bypass
the App Store payment system this of
course violated apple and fortnite was
removed from the App Store epic
responded by pointing out the irony in
Apple's 1984 ad then proceeded to file a
lawsuit suit but eventually lost that
suit in 2021 but recently Apple approved
epic games developer account which means
fortnite could be coming back to iOS but
then yesterday Apple apparently had a
change of heart epic's developer account
was terminated which means no fortnite
on iOS Apple accused epic games of
egregious breaches to its developer
agreements and said that the courts made
it clear that it has the sole discretion
to terminate developer accounts but you
might be wondering what are these
egregious violations well Apple cited
one of them as this tweet from Tim
Sweeney where basically he says Apple
developers create Banger products but
their corporate policies are cringe AF
yeah you heard that correctly Apple
banned a developer over a mildly
critical tweet however Apple's move
might be illegal under dma and the
bureaucrats in Belgium are already on
the case as a side note Sweeney also
referenced Apple's recent decision to
drop Progressive web apps from Safari
Apple was never a fan of pwas and what's
funny is that they Ed dma as an excuse
to remove them entirely in reality
though pwas are great for consumers and
developers but a threat to the App Store
that's another story entirely but it
really does seem like apple is
speedrunning the destruction of its
relationship with developers ultimately
I think apple is trying to make an
example out of Epic very few developers
have the resources of Epic and would die
instantly if they were kicked out of the

that means you might want to think twice

have an apple developer account myself
and pay my $100 annual tribute and I for
one absolutely love Apple's policies the
biggest tragedy in all of this is that
